page.title: 15TILE KILN ESTATE CHELMSFORD
page.content:
The Tile Kiln Estate is a residential area mainly built in the 1970's. It covers an area of about one square kilometre to the south of Chelmsford.
The Estate takes its name from the farm whose land the houses are now built on.The farm buildings no longer exist.{Brick and tile making}has been carried out in this area since{Roman {times}as Essex has no natural building stone and the clay soil here is just right for bricks and tiles.There were once many brick and tile works in the {Chelmsford and Galleywood}area but none are left today.
The Estate has its own parade of five shops;as well as two primary schools, a public house and a church.
